Right across the street from one of the best beaches in sunny California at a very reasonable price! The hotel staff were very accommodating even with a room change in the midst of our stay. The free breakfast allows for easy, self-serve breakfast without waiting to be served and taking time from a busy day.

The most terrible service, small outdated rooms, smelly rooms, not worth the money!!!! i would never stay at this hotel for this amount of money per night, the only amenity was that you were able to smoke ion the patio, and the ocean view. the staff were unfriendly and  no luggage cart was brought to us we had to find it ourselves the elevator was slow and the smell was disgusting. overall rating of this hotel was 1 out of 10.

You can't beat the location of this hotel.  Right on the beach and near the pier.  Rooms were clean and nice...although not luxurious.  Teri at the front desk was super nice/helpful and even let me borrow a cell phone charger because I forgot mine.  I would definitely stay here again.

We were looking for a place close to the beach at the last minute and were able to get a room here for a somewhat reasonable price. Rooms were clean and hotel was nice. We would stay here again if we had the chance!

I love this place. Been staying here for more than twenty years and it is my favorite beach place to stay in all of California. The staff is always friendly and helpful. I have see  many improvements throughout the years. The location in Huntington Beach is terrific and in Southern California is very convenient. I  have become an expert at turning a Friday Seminar into a 4 or 5 day weekend at the beach. With a friend or alone I always hate to have to leave.

Close to the Pier, great room, very comfortable and clean overall, and much, much better than expected.  I give this hotel five stars!  Breakfast was really superb, including waffles!  As far as the fruit was concerned it was fresh and delicious.  The coffee was good and the breakfast room was pleasant.  Our waitress who took care of us both mornings was absolutely fantastic, going out of her way to help us.  When I reserved the room my message said I had a partial view of the ocean.  It was more than partial!  It was spectacular!  Since the hotel is right on the beach the sound of the surf was as pleasant as always, and our room was so comfortable.  When we checked in the room was spotless and things were arranged decoratively around the sink, the wash cloth crinkled creatively

My stay was great!  The hotel was clean, staff was very friendly and helpful.  It was a great price. I will definitely return to this hotel in the future.  Great location walking distance from beach, shopping and restaurants!

Huntington Beach Best Western right downtown, close to the pier and all the restaurants and shopping, was a terrific time! The staff were extremely nice and very helpful. The room was very clean and the staff went out of their way to help us with questions about activities and restaurants in the area.

good friendly front desk ,nice out put so never ever fuss coming, best room  service, all house -keepers are very friendly and hard working persons,making room very neat and clean,and giving very nice and prompt room service,lobby and all floors are looking very clean,the house keeper do room& bath room very neat and clean,and the hotel providing nice brake- fast in brake fast room and all staff was very friendly,and helping person,they made brake fast room very neat and clean,and provide nice hot brake fast to us,there nice swimming pool,so i liked that BEST WESTERN, i have no more bad experience about this hotel, location very great,so i go and stay in BEST WESTERN,

My husband and I stayed here for just one night. We stayed on the second floor with a wonderful view if the ocean! This place is on the PCH right across from Huntington Beach. It has a lovely roof top jacuzzi, they only let 8 people up at a time but we had it all to ourselves the evening we stayed. We got to watch the sunset from up there and it was amazing! The front desk people were kind but at one point it was just the owner down there and he didn't even acknowledge us standing there waiting for service. We checked in around 130 and that was nice to get in early. We had a nap and a lovely couple hours on the beach. Later that night my husband had me switch him sides of the bed to accommodate his CPAP machine. At this time I noticed a distinct urine smell on this side of the

Check in process took 30 minutes and I was the only person there. Then, the man at the front desk had a lot of trouble calling me a cab -- kind of a problem when you work at the front desk of a hotel. The room smelled old and stale and the bed left a lot to be desired.
Manager Response: Hello dear guest we are sorry you had a bad experience. we are very competetive as far as pricing goes for the area.you had the lowest price possible.we are located practically on the beach and our prices are seasonal.yes it is very hard to get a cab on a very busy night the key word is we were trying.we cannot control the cab or its driver,we can only call them.as far as the room was concerned you were fine with it and since it was wedding we even allowed all the guys visiting you.i am sorry you felt your stay was unaccomodating we tried our best.perhaps next time you can be more realistic and concentrate on the beach.THANK YOU

Summary: The location of this hotel is spectacular.  You are literally one streetlight from the beach.  It takes 3 minutes to walk.  Sancho tacos next door, yum.  Main Street Huntington is a 5 minute walk at most.  No need for a cab.  The pier is also about a 5 minute walk.  The hotel bathroom was very clean which I always check first.  The linens were clean as well.  The room itself was a little dingy.  The hotel could use a remodel on carpet, walls and furniture and then I would rate it with 10 stars all the way! I think the staff does a good job of keeping it clean but old is old.  The staff had spray to make the rooms smell nice, but again, old is old.  Overall, a great spot for a good price.  I will stay again.
Manager Response: Thank you so much as the new g/m i am pleased that our guests recognize the value of our location.you can see the pier from our lobby and hop over pch and you are in the sand.please come again and enjoy my welcoming staff and our hotel.

Summary: This hotel is the best I have ever been to, especially it's customer service! The employers make you feel welcomed. I most love the beautiful view and rooms. Looking forward to another stay soon. A perfect vacation stay especially for those who love the beach. But regardless it's still so fun and enjoyable! The location is beautiful as well.

Summary: I recently stayed in this Hotel was a lil hesitant at first Because of the reviews I read but i decided to judge by my own experience so I booked my stay and I gotta say I was pleasantly surprised with the cleanliness of the room we stayed in .. the staff was extremely nice the service provided exceeded my  expectations I will be returning to this Hotel on my next vacation

Summary: I recently stayed here with my family for spring break and it was a wonderful stay! the staff was nice and were very welcoming. We stayed in room 301 and it was wonderful! It had a great view of the beach during the day and we had the nice sounds of the ocean to listen to at night from our jacuzzi. During the day we went to the beach, or to Disneyland or Knotts Berry farm (all of which are within a 30 minute drive in good traffic). The stay was great and we will definitely be coming back for a future vacation!

Summary Heading: Great location at a great price
Summary: Staff is wonderful.   Beach is across the street and all the niight life is in walking distance. Hotel room is large and has an area for working.  Also has refrigerator and microwave in room for longer stays.

Wonderful perks, such as gas fireplace, baloney, breakfast, and the location cannot be any better.  Many beach hotels are a little dirty or worn down, but this one is beautifully kept, and the staff very nice.  Comfy beds, lots of pillows and good comforters and linens.  Quiet, clean, warm, and cozy.

We arrived at this hotel quite late in the afternoon and when we checked in we were offered an upgrade to a part-sea view for $10, we took this and had a nice room with a balcony looking towards the beach, although we did also overlook the water pump thing!  The hotel was clean and comfortable and adequate for our requirements. We went down the road to a FANTASTIC restaurant called "Spark", it had the most amazing food, worth a visit.

Summary Heading: Brilliant location, its all about the roof top.
Summary: Stayed for one night coming from L.A. to San Diego, great area everything was perfect for us. Definitely will return again. Right next to the beach and the cool pier there. Free Parking. Right off the Pacific Coast Highway. Its just right on a budget.

Last minute trip to Huntington Beach so I booked the room on their website. Asked for an ocean view or partial ocean view and got neither. Room was clean but the balcony was tiny and actually had a window that looked right into the room next door. The clerk that checked us in was not very friendly and seemed a little put out. When I called for another room and told them of the window he state they had no other rooms (which I don't think was true) and that if the room next door to us didn't want us looking into their room, then they should close their blinds. Like I said not very friendly or helpful. Room was not that much cheaper than the Shorebreak or Waterfront but since this was just one night I though I would give it a try. Sorry that I did and won't be back! Filled out

Summary Heading: Check in not Friendly, Horrible Room!
Summary: Took my daughter to Huntington Beach for one night before going to Disney. When I checked in the front desk clerk acted like he didn't really care and answered several calls while checking me in. The room we received 212 was nice inside but the balcony was very small and actually looked into the room next door. I requested an ocean view or at least a partial view and the room had no view (except the roof and into the window of the room next door). When i asked to be relocated he said he had nothing else and that the room next door should shut their drapes if they didn't want us looking in which really couldn't be helped if you stood on the balcony! Not a good value at all for almost $200 per night! For an extra $30 per night stay at the Waterfront or Shorebreak!

The first time I stayed here it was great. Nothing fancy, but a perfect location and it was clean.  The second and last time I stayed here, it was a nightmare. We walked into our room and a sink had overflowed and brought up sand and hair with it. The floor was soaked and there was nasty hair all over the sink, vanity, and floor. The front desk clerk was less than helpful and insisted on checking it out because she didn't believe us. We were moved to another room and the desk clerk made it very clear that we were disturbing her. The next room was less than clean, but we had to leave for an appointment and didn't have time to deal with the room. On our way out we asked that the room be cleaned. Not surprisingly, it wasn't clean when we returned. In addition, we could not get the

Summary Heading: No frills, but one of the least expensive near the beach
Summary: The hotel is nothing special, but generally clean and right across form the beach and an easy walk to downtown Huntington Beach. The free breakfast is surprisingly good. They recently upgraded to legit WiFi, which resolved my previous issue with prior visits. I stay here a few weeks every year for business.

I have an ocean view king. I have a full room view of the ocean and beach.Room is nicely sized, clean, up to date with large flat screen tv. Nice deck. And if you locked yourself out there it is because you are an idiot or don't know how to read. I stayed at the Hyatt last year, it was very nice but cost me $20.00 every time I left the room. This place is walking distance to everywhere. Just perfect! Nice walk on the pier after dinner at Dukes. Staff is friendly and helpful. I don't know why they had rude reviews, of course I am not trying to sneak a ton of people in my room. I have to admit I was worried because of the reviews , but I live this place and plan on coming back. Beds are comfy. We just ate breakfast and it was really good. Usually free breakfasts are stale and not

My husband and I stayed here for one night in December 2013.  We wanted to have a night out near the day and night life, within walking distance, and not pay too much for a place considering we would only need a place to crash.  This is no resort, so nothing was spectacular, but it's not supposed to be.  Everything was clean and up-to-date, which was perfect for us.  Standard rooms come with a fridge, which was nice for beverages.  We were able to walk to  Ra sushi for dinner which was very close.  We also went to various places/bars on Main Street during the day and night.  It wasn't too far of a walk for us, and I was in heels mind you, but I suppose it might be for others.  The beach is across the street, if you are looking to spend your day there.  We weren't interested in

Very nice hotel location right on the beach. Could use a little updating on room items. I did not like that in order to use the spa you had to go to the front desk and leave your ID in exchange for the key to get into the spa area. You then had to return to the front desk to get your ID back when you were finished. Not thought thru very well on the Hotel part, its just a inconvenience to the hotel guests. Your room key should work for this.

Me and my family stayed at this Best Western for 1 night because we were on the road all day and needed a place to stay. It was the best place to stay in the area. Upon checking in the front desk clerk was friendly and he was very helpful of where to find a place for dinner and checked us in without further incident. The room was supposed to have 2 queen beds but, we're clearly double beds, it was clean but, the pillows were hard and half the length of a standard pillow. And the sliding door had a broken lock which made us uneasy considering 2 people were getting arrested outside of our window and the neighborhood was sketchy it's self. But, the TV was brand new and the room was very well maintained. Overall I would recommend staying there:)

After one night at another hotel that had major construction going on moved to the Best Western for 3 nights.  Had a great stay.  Arrived at the hotel several hours before check in.  Room was not ready but they let us park our car in the free underground parking.  Had a King room with partial ocean view.  Lots of room for 2 people.  Nice mini frig and microwave.  Had breakfast one morning it was basic but fine for us.  I would say this is a basic hotel in a great location.  Would definitely stay again. Couldn't beat the price for the location.  We took advantage of the roof top to get some sun time in.  It was in the 80's and we're from Washington.  Spa and rooftop are small and would not be convenient in busy times because they only allow 8 people up at a time.  If you don't

We have stayed here several times. No it's not fancy, but we love the location and the view is the best. We splurged this time and booked the room with fireplace and jacuzzi. We were not disappointed with either! Its within walking distance of shopping and places to eat or you can just enjoy the view. You cannot go wrong with this place.

Nice stay; terrific, friendly, helpful staff.  The breakfast room was incredibly small, certainly not handicap friendly and the door was locked so you could not get coffee after 9:30 am.  Room was very clean and the view was spectacular.

We were close to the beach, downtown area and found good value, clean rooms and a fresh but limlted breakfast. Weather was perfect so the proximity to everything was awesome. Definitely would stay there again

Hotel was conveniently located for the beach and the downtown area with restaurants and bars.  Continental breakfast was just fine.  Only issue was that the pillows were on the small size and seemed to be rock hard.

Summary Heading: I STAYED THERE 19 NGHTS : SO GOOD
Summary: Yes 19 nights ! I  Went there to be close to my kids that leave in Huntington Beach with their mother. Very good  price for ocean view rooms . Fenomenal location right acoss the street from the beach , plus it is  four blocks from the Main Street where there's plenty of options for dining , shopping , etc .  The room have evrything you need and they keep it very  clean . Hotel is  very quiet so you can sleep so well. Personal staff is so good and  always ready to help in any anithing I needed ,  specially   a  front desk woman  called Teri Laporte ,  she always attended my requests right away , gave me so perfect informations  of what to visit in HB and she was always  so kind  all the time. I wil go back there for sure.

I was recently vacationing in Huntington beach and thought I would check out some different hotels in the area to see what they had to offer.  Based on the unfriendly, inattentive front desk staff and dinginess of the hotel lobby I would not even attempt to stay in this hotel.  The woman at the desk acted as if she were bothered when I inquired about the rooms.  It is never a good start when the person you have manning the desk can't even choke out a simple hello.  There are many other hotels in the area that will be more than happy to at least say hi when I am giving them my money.

I'll never stay here again.  It's overpriced for what you get.  Accommodations are okay, but staff is rude and unhelpful and make you feel like dirtbags.  You can hear every conversation people have in the rooms next to you or in the hall, hear the toilet flush from the room above and think that the ceiling is about to cave in, and hear everyone walk/run on the floor above you.  Plus you get charged a deposit fee up front and then they take a couple of days to refund that to you.

Stayed here for just one night while visiting Huntington Beach. The front desk staff was very nice. The room was very clean. Had a fridge and microwave. Did not get to make it down to the breakfast so I cannot comment on that. Was nice that it had underground parking. Location is  perfect! Across the street from the beach and just a couple of blocks from Main St. and the pier. We were able to park the car and walk every where. We liked it so much that we are staying again on our next trip to HB in January.

Don't know why I saw some bad reviews about uncaring staff. My personal experience with the housekeeping & breakfast attendant were great. They were friendly, helpful & polite. The front desk staff could improve though. Am accustomed to being asked how my stay was when I check out, being thanked for staying at the hotel and/or told they hope to see me back soon. None of that happpened. I was just asked to sign my credit card slip. The room was clean & very convenient with a mini fridge & a micro. FREE parking. What a great perk especially when everywhere you go has metered parking. Even the beaches have meters!!! FREE breakfast, what a deal! Location was perfect. Lots in walking distance! Saw security cameras & video monitor at front desk. Didn't bother me at all! Don't know why

Summary Heading: Insanely close to beach, great proximity to shopping and food!
Summary: This hotel was so close to the beach!  We enjoyed a few restaurants within walking distance and the shopping was great!  The hotel was clean and the staff was very friendly!   Next time, I wish we would've known about the breakfast but I'll remember to ask first.  This was a last minute decision to stay in Huntington and we loved it!

My wife and I stayed 2 days at this Hotel, the walks on the Beach were awesome, the Beach Volleyball nets everywhere just like you see in the movies, and at night the walk on the pier and the sound of the wave, the young people along the beach enjoying themselves was memorable, there is people fishing on the pier and at the very end there's an old type of 60's version of Diner with the waiters and waitress with red and white uniforms, also great location for Disneyland which is 10 minutes away by car,

Room was old and dirty, the deck chairs moldy,  the staff couldn't care less, and it was more expensive then the 4-star hotels I stayed in around the same time.  The outside looks good but it is not any place to sleep unless you like little pillows and lumpy beds.

Hotel was a bit old and had problems with someone messing with my bike in the parking garage.  The location was close to dining and the beach. Check out took forever. Need more help or someone with more knowledge.

Summary Heading: Affordable clean tidy hotel close to all amenities
Summary: After staying 7 nites at this hotel we found it a great central location for a great stay. We found the staff friendly and helpful and willing to extend themselves to help you. The young girl Teri at reception was pleasant on the eye and had a lovely welcoming smile. The only thing is when we come back again I will be sure to bring my own pillow as I found there's to be hard. We would recommend this hotel for staying when visiting Huntington  beach

Summary Heading: Affordable HB Hotel across the street from beach
Summary: Great location. Across the street from the beach and a very short walk to the pier. Safe seven mile bicycle ride to Newport Beach. Rooms are clean, but a slight musty smell that comes with being so close to the beach. Slight interference on some TV channels, but not there to watch TV. Great complimentary breakfast. Will stay there again.

We had family in from out of state and were looking forward to our stay in Huntington Beach. When we arrived we were informed that only the four people registered to the room would be able to enter the hotel at all. Anyone else would have to wait in the lobby or outside. We had others with us that were NOT spending the night but, I thought would be able to go into our room. They really need to make this policy known so people are not surprised. There is also $100 cleaning fee that is held until check out. Be aware if you are on a buget, they do run your C.C.

Despite a terrific location, Management is terrible. In particular, Ken the GM.   He literally robbed me.  When I arrived to check in, I was told that my reservation had been cancelled??When I asked for a Mgr. - Ken was presented as GM.  He would not even discuss the situation or examine my email confirmation, etc......but then 'discovered' he just happened to have ANOTHER room - the last one in fact - that just happened to match the exact days i needed.   HOWEVER, as my original reservation had been 'cancelled', he could no longer honor the original rate quoted.   If I wanted this 'new' room, it would be an add'l $100.00/night.   I was working an event across the street - was expected at a meeting - he literally had me over a barrel, so I took the room. To add insult to injury

Summary Heading: Best hotel in Beach for value
Summary: Best value and clean comfortabel rooms. and no charge to park. We really enjoyed our stay and will do so again.  If you looking to stay close to the beach, close shopping and surfing, there is no better value, quality and location than at this Best Western Hotel.

this place sit right on PCH and you know it, with the noise of the road and people. The musty room smell does not help either.I Won't stay again. It was by the beach wich was the only nice thing about the stay. I ahve stayed at motel six's at better value. The room price was way over for what you get.

DO NOT STAY HERE! This was by far the worst hotel experience my family and I have ever experienced. The staff was completely rude, unprofessional, and made the hotel feel more like a prison. They have a huge TV at the front desk where they monitor every part of the hotel through hidden cameras so it kind of makes me wonder what else they might be monitoring that is not on the front desks TV. Not only that but my family member had his card reported stolen by the front desk clerk and that caused a whole other batch of issues for our vacation. We tried to leave after one incident of letting our friends in for a drink upstairs in our room before we walked out for dinner but the hotel WOULD NOT EVEN LET THEM IN! At the point we had been there for an hour and asked for our money back,

Summary Heading: Spend your hard earned dollar elsewhere
Summary: Staff is hardly welcoming or helpful. Rooms are antiquated and items within are in poor standard. Having stayed at the Shorebreak and the Hilton waterfront one expects a downgrade from those experiences. However the price if this hotel rivals the Shorebreak and this establishment is far far far worse.

Summary Heading: Never ever again in my life stay at this hotel
Summary: The only good thing about this hotel is the location! We got there, it took forever to check in because no one was at the front desk! After we got the key, we went in the room where we found trash on the floor and the bathroom was not clean! I asked to talk to a manager and the guy at the front desk asked me what the problem is and he talked to the ladies at the housekeeping! I never got to talk to a manager! Was a really special  vacation for us and everything was perfect besides the hotel where we stayed!

The location is great! Center close on the beach! Hotel is old but ok. Prices are rediculously high.  Breakfast is small, but ok. Ends at 9.30, way to early, by a really rude lady. Will pick another place next time

We stayed here in May 2013. Room was spacious and had a balcony. Front desk staff were very friendly and helpful. We decided to stay longer. Great hot tub on the roof for watching sunset. Short walk to Main Street where all the action is. Only draw back - smoking is allowed on the balconies. I.E. marijuana smoking Is allowed on the balconies. After all, it is legal in CA.

Summary Heading: If there's nowhere else to stay
Summary: For an extra $20 per night, you can find much nicer places to stay. The lobby is shabby, the man at the front desk is borderline rude, the room was cramped, window curtains were dingy, and the bathroom barely has room in which to turn around. The room was advertised as having a balcony, and it does; however, there is no door to the balcony - just a plate glass window - which renders the balcony useless. Air conditioning sortof works. Booked my next night at a much nicer place a couple of blocks down the street - a little more per night, but well worth it!

We are currently at this facility now. The location is great, within walking distance to the city pier and all of the great restaurants. Overall, we have no complaints, the king room is smaller than normal and their towels need to be replaced with something soft, as it is like drying with a piece of cardboard. We would come again, just for the location.

Summary Heading: Great Location...But thats were it ends.
Summary: Stayed at this location on 4/15 - 4/18. This is the 4th time I have stayed here. I was told my room rate for two people would be $143.99 per night. I changed the reservation to 4 people and was told it would be approximately $20/night more. I said that was fine.  The first night, the AC didn't work and nobody was able to sleep. We were moved to another identical room on night 2. We had to have keys re-coded multiple time and finally the electronic lock went dead and we had to get the receptionist to let us in. An offensive odor was noted coming from under the sink (likey the P-trap).Having the sink vanity outside the bathroom when multiple people are staying in the room is certainly less than ideal.  My wife handled the check out and was not aware of the agreed upon room rates,

Everything about this hotel was good except for 2 things. The bed was horribly unconfortable and the front desk staff was simply aweful. They were uninterested in answering even the simplest questions and some were downright rude. Including eyerolling to a request for an extra blanket.

We booked a room just for two nights ( because we read no nice reviews about this place), but finally extended to 10 nights. Room was clean and spacious with ocean view. Just breakfast was in a very small room (3 tables), so sometimes we grabbed coffee and cornflakes and ate in the room :)  It's great location, close to the beach and main street. Definitely we will be back there.

We stayed in this hotel on January 29, 2013.  This was our second stay.  It continued to meet our standards and expectations.  The front desk personnel were helpful as they were the last time.  The woman who checked us in was the same one from our previous visit 2 years ago.  Same courtesy and knowledge of the city.  The room was spotless and it appeared many rooms were being remodeled and/or updated.  The bed was comfortable and clean.  We don't stay in the room very much so the TV was not important to us, although we noted there were limited channels.  The balcony facing the ocean was just as enjoyable as last time, and it's always fun to use the elevator with its view of the ocean.  Although it's located right on PCH, noise was not an issue.  We were able to get a very

Summary Heading: Great Location for a Huntington Beach Visit
Summary: We booked a stay at this Best Western for our Surf City Half Marathon visited. Having never visited Huntington Beach before, I didn't know what to expect from the city or the hotel. The "official" race resorts wanted at least twice the price of this property; we figured we could walk the less-than-one-mile to the start and finish line and save a few dollars. We are totally happy with that decision.  First on my list of hotel requirements is cleanliness; I was delighted to find our room was spotless. Yes, you can clearly see that it is not a sparkly-brand-new property. Duh. This hotel is steps from the beach; that means hapless tourists running back and forth across the street and dumping all of their sand from their beach play all over their hotel room, bathroom, sink, etc. Yet

I was originally supposed to stay here for two nights, but after one night, I checked out.  With the exception of an excellent location, it was awful.  The television in our room buzzed loudly during half the channels.  The sink was about two feet from one of the beds and it was leaking if you turned the knob the wrong way.  I complained to the front desk and was told that they were in the process of making changes.  Breakfast is served in a very small room, with seats for 8 people. The only thing that looked somewhat appetizing was the yogurt (because it was in a sealed container).  The orange juice tasted like Tang.  If I were to do it again, I would skip this hotel and pay the same price to stay somewhere nicer a little further from the beach.

A one night stay passing through on our way south. The hotel is walking distance to shops, bars and restaurants. The rooms are OK but we did have problems with the sliding glass door in our room not working. Noise from the heaters in other rooms is audible, and even with the heater on we needed an extra blanket. Traffic noise isn't intrusive, but also audible. Pillows seem to be a cheap foam as others have commented. Staff were very nice and helpful. Parking was good. There is another BW heading out of town which is a short drive away which trades distance for a pool and some would say quieter rooms. All in, a good stay but could be better with some small improvements.

The hotel was nice. Close to restaurants and business. Right across the street from the pier and beach. The bike trails are great. The hotel was clean and service was good. Continental breakfast was not bad.

Worst staff ever.  Smelled like pot in the lobby.  Pay the extra money and stay at the Hyatt or Hilton down the street.  We left at 2:00 am and went to the Hyatt.  The staff are phsyco!!  Infact the night clerk was so crazy I called the cops on her.

So, we decided to try the Best Western Huntington Beach Inn. The view is wonderful. Not much else was.   The rooms were really in need of updating. The staff was not friendly. It wasn't as clean as we expect.   After a few nights, we decided to change hotels and ended back up at the Best Western Regency Inn. They do not have a view! The rooms were larger. The breakfast was better. The staff is very friendly. The rooms have been updated and are much cleaner. Our only complaint is that there are never enough towels left in our rooms, but when we request them, they are delivered right away.   We are glad that we tried the BW Huntington Beach Inn. We felt that we were really missing the beach staying at the other hotel, but found out that the view just isn't worth the accommodations

The room needs 1 extra blanket and some pillows that are flatter,  not so spongy.  Enjoyed our stay and good breakfast choices.  The lighting in the underground parking was great!        Location was good, close to the Hunting Bch pier.

This was our third stay here.  As always, it is about the location.  It is hard to get better than across the PCH from the Beach.  The staff as always is friendly and they were accommodating of my wife's chemical sensitivity.  The provided breakfast gets one going and the proximity to restaurants in walking distance is great.  The rooms are good and the third floor view is one of the things we look forward too each visit.  The internet access we used was wired, however our net-book said it could see the wireless router.  We chose the wired for security reasons and the speed was good.  The cable and TV in the rooms are only average.  The devices are CR Tube and not flat screen, and the cable is not HD and there are limited channels.  But with the beach and restaurants close at

Summary Heading: Great location. Not much to expect otherwise.
Summary: Location of the property is great, just a couple blocks down from the pier, Main Street, and right on PCH. I didn't go in with high expectations - it was a bed for a couple nights at a time as we went in and out of the area. Overall, we stayed a total of 7 nights over the course of 3 weeks.  Rooms are clean. Cable is static-y in all 3 rooms we stayed in. Breakfast is fine - basic continental breakfast plus they have a kind of cool, but annoyingly loud self-serve waffle maker. Free parking underneath for guests. I found the front desk staff to be a bit strange at all shifts, but they checked us in and checked us out without incident so no complaints.

The location is great. Right across the street from the beach, close to the pier, and within walking distance to downtown restaurants and shops. Underground parking and rooftop Jacuzzi nice. However you have to leave your id with the front desk just to get up to the Jacuzzi. Breakfast area is so small that its hard to even get to the food if the two tables are full. The front desk staff is not friendly at all. It needs a lot of updates on the rooms. But for the price it was worth it for the location.

Had to spent one night out of the house due to some repairs.  I only live 10 minutes away from this property and therefore will offer a perspective as a local resident rather than as a tourist.  Most of the hotels/motels off of Beach Blvd do not appear very appealing and unless you want to spend the big bucks staying at the Hyatt or any others off Pacific Coast Hwy near the Huntington Beach Pier, you really have few choices and should set your expectations really, really low.  That said, I checked out this property on TripAdvisor 20 minutes prior to checking in.  The desk clerk was cordial and got me a room within 5 minutes on the 2nd floor toward the back.  The room condition surpassed my expectations - I can tell it was refurbished, but the improvements is definitely above

Stayed here for a week.  Great location opposite the beach.  Free underground parking and no resort charge.  Room was OK with really comfortable bed and had small balcony which was a bonus.  Spotlessly clean.  Complimentary breakfast which most people trayed up and took to their rooms.  Short walk into town and would recommend much better breakfast at The Sugar Shack.  No pool but hot spa and loungers on roof which was good   Have not been a fan of Great Western generally but thought this was really good value for money.

Summary Heading: Nice, and close to all the fun stuff.
Summary: The rooms are clean, great view of the beach, right close to main street and the beach, free  underground parking, fridge, microwave, free Wi-Fi, a.c., tv, service was friendly. Pillows were a bit big for my liking, but that's personal preference. The bed was super comfortable.  There was no sign to hang on our door saying "don't clean our room", and there was no lock box, so my belongings didn't feel entirely safe, but everything else was great.

we did not have a reservation and when we walked in to check availability, I was very turned off by the appearance of the lobby and how outdated it looked.  The woman behind the counter was not the friendliest and couldn't believe the price.  BUT, after seeing the location for a one night stay, and checking out the room before we committed, we stayed. Turned out the room was comfortable and we had a view of the ocean.  We were on the beach, (hotels are all across the street) and a few blocks from EVERYTHING.  Main street is the place to be for shopping and eating, although beware that later in the evening most of the bars turn into nightclubs.  So if you're 40 somethings like us, you might enjoy the smaller hole in the wall type places with a guitar player and great company.

Summary Heading: great location but lacks a few services
Summary: The hotel is a good US local hotel if on a budget. It is located in the best possible location- in fact better that he Hilton and The Hyatt- superb for shopping, cocktails etc etc  for an international traveller it is a bit lacking though. I asked about a do not disturb sign ans they said they did not do them and it was a requirement to go into my room every day.  Was also guaranteed a balcony as per expedia and when I checked into the ground floor they told me a patio was the same as a balcony in the USA and thus that would have to do.  I then asked if there was a safe and was told no but they had safe deposit boxes- not ideal for a traveller from abroad.   They have a nice jacuzzi on the roof which is great.   Also asked for a taxi to be booked for me at 5 am which was not

Summary Heading: Would definitely NOT recommend this hotel...
Summary: My husband and I travel a lot and this is the first time and lately, I make it a point to review most hotels we stay in. We stayed at this BW only because there was a mess up with our other hotel reservation. I would NEVER choose to stay here. It does not appear to be that old but is in very poor and dirty condition. It is obvious that there has been no work put into it or maintenance done on any of the rooms or building. The front desk attendant was far from friendly and in my opinion, quite expensive for what you get. There are many many other hotels along the beach to choose from - keep driving when u get to this one. I see that there are quite a few negative reviews on this hotel but not one response from BW? Come on Best Western... Where's your customer service?

Summary Heading: Definitely not a place to write home (to Australia) about!
Summary: My husband and I were traveling through Huntington Beach and decided to stay the night. We had no booking, and when I enquiries about a room, we were told there was only room left; the king/jacuzzi suite on the 2nd floor. As it was late in the aftermoon and we didn't know the area well, we accepted. The room was "comfortable" but not quite what we expected in terms of cost. We were required to pay a $100 security regarding the jacuzzi because guests in the past had overfilled or mis-used it in the past and the manager made a point of telling me that we must follow the instructions for use. Later that nite, after we had used the jacuzzi (responsibly!), we got a call from a female manager to advise us that the guest in the room below us had reported water dripping from their

The rack rate at this hotel isn't bad, but the internet rates are usually great. Kayak, and even the Best Western site have deals quite often. It is smart to check those sites first. The hotel is well maintained, and the location is great - right on PCH. The funny thing about Huntington Beach is that there are very few hotels right on the beach. This is probably your best bet, of those few.

Summary Heading: The location is the only reason really to stay here
Summary: I generally stay at Hilton and Marriott or at least Holiday Inn properties, but for this last week of a project I'd been on, I really wanted to stay somewhere within walking distance of Main Street (where all the bars and restaurants are at).  I also needed to stay under a certain price point for the project.  I can say that the hotel is a few blocks walk from where I wanted to be, so in that respect it's a win.  But the rooms were tiny, like the bed took up the majority of the room.  And the bathroom had the sink/vanity next to the bed and not in the toilet/shower room.  This is pretty clear evidence that the hotel is old.  I'm pretty sure the television was an old tube and not a flatscreen.  It did have a refrigerator which was nice.  The room I was in had a balcony (as I

This hotel is a great bargain if you are looking to stay at the beach without spending a fortune. It's right across the street from the beach, and a couple of blocks from the pier. We walked to the restaurants and bars on Main St. The night we were there, a Tuesday night, they had a huge outdoor market on Main St. Lots to see and they even had live music.   The rooms are clean, and the parking is convenient.

My wife and I stay at a lot of hotels around the country but if we are ever not sure where to stay we can always stay at a Best Western. That‚Äôs what we did this past weekend. We arrived at the Best Western Huntington Beach CA at 800 Pacific Coast Hwy Friday April 6, 2012. My wife and I learned that the elevator was being worked on and would be out of service for the weekend. This was not stated on the web site, nor disclosed when the reservation was made by phone, and our room was on the 3rd floor. When we got to our room my wife went to use the restroom and I opened the curtains to see the view of the ocean. I sat down on the sofa and was not able to see through the windows; they were filthy. My wife came over and told me that she had cleaned pubic hear off the floor by the

Summary Heading: Location is good - the rest is just OK
Summary: This hotel is in a good location - close to the beach and to shopping and nightlife.  The rooms are OK - nothing fancy but not uncomfortable.  Had a great bath in the jacuzzi tub and the balcony was nice (although the proximity to a busy street meant we didn't spend tons of time out there.)  The room was very loud (thin walls/ceilings meant we were listening to our upstairs neighbors pacing around for the majority of the night.)  When we complained, the front desk was very responsive but unfortunately it didn't resolve the issue.

Summary Heading: OK Facilities, Odd Rules and Poor Service
Summary: Stayed at this hotel for the first time for an event this weekend at the pier.  The room was clean, comfortable, and well taken care of.  The fireplace in the room was nice, as was the view of the ocean from the balcony.  The location is great, right across PCH from the beach and a short walk to the pier.  However, the elevator is shut down for maintenance on the shaft from 8:30 - 5:30 each day.  This means that those that cannot navigate the stairs (such as one who was in my party) must be out of the room before 8:30 am and cannot return until after 5:30 p.m.  When the desk was asked what their policy on this is, considering people that can't use the stairs can't get to their rooms (or out of them, should there be a problem) we were told "we don't know, it hasn't come up".  No

Just checked into this hotel and wish I would have booked the Hilton.  Contrary to other rooms, my room # 109 is small and does NOT have an ocean view. In addition, although I am a Platinum member, I was not given a complimentary upgrade, but rather was told that this hotel does not do upgrades.  I was also informed that I could BUY an upgrade- even though this is one of the main benefits of being a Platinum member. I  immediately called the Best Western customer service hotline and they were stunned to hear this.  They contacted the front desk and were told the same information.    In the end, the cust. service representative handled things the right way and changed my status to Diamond as a result of this stiuation.  She is also calling the manager tomorrow to find out why

We have stayed here twice now.  Each time, the week before Thanksgiving wanting the sea shore without the busy season.  We selected this hotel for its proximity to the ocean, dining and cost.  This establishment offers all of that.  The ocean is across the PCH and can be seen from many if not all of the room balconies. Dining is an easy walk of three short blocks to the main street and pier. With many choices in dining available without driving, and even more if you don't mind a drive.  This Best Western is not a five star place and doesn't pretend to be.  If you want that there is one down the PCH 10 minutes drive.  These are decent clean rooms close to the big attraction, the ocean.  The free breakfast is what is expected, a reasonable selection of continental breakfast foods

Summary Heading: Great location, clean rooms, free parking and friendly staff
Summary: We drove down from LA w/ no reservation hoping to find something close to the beach and walking distance to downtown HB so we could go out on the town at night and be at the beach in the morning without having to drive anywhere. We stopped a few places on PCH and all were in the same price range- $150-$175, but the Best Western appeared the cleanest and close enough to the action, but not where it would be too loud. We got a double "family" room at the single price as the last single was booked online as we were in the lobby. The room was a good size, average decor (not hideous, not what I'd want a home) and really clean, especially the bathroom. The beds were Serta's and appeared to be new. Many rooms have a balcony, but ours didn't but the view was still decent.  The TV wasn't

Summary Heading: Good price and beach hook up.
Summary: This place is nothing fancy but it is nice.  Good customer service and you get a beach view from EVERY room.  So don't pay more for an upgraded room, you get the same view.  If you get the suite has a fun hottub and it is very large!  I think they rotate the same rooms because we stayed one night and we were changing hotels the next night.  We referred our friend to stay here and they immidiately put him in our previously occupied room instead of several hundred others that were not being occupied.  You can walk anywhere and I like to go in the summer on the weekends when they have a farmers market.

Small hotel on PCH.  Rooms were clean but a little dated.  Beds were comfortable.  Rooms with views can be noisy but worth it. Views of the beach were wonderful.  Easy walk to the beach, dining and enterainment. Breakfast was okay.  Breakfast area was too small.  Staff was friendly and helpful.

Best western never seems to fail, we had a great stay here the staff were friendly and the rooms were great we had a particle view of the beach and it was fine and it was only 2 blocks away from the main street, The room included a fridge and a microwave and the rooms were great, breakfast included it was OK but fine for a quick bite before exploring Huntington Beach which was beautiful.

I booked three rooms for my family visiting from Norway at the Best Western Huntington Beach Inn.  Check in was smooth and they were all thrilled to see they had a fireplace in their room, plus a balcony with a view of the ocean!  We immediately walked around Main Street HB to shop, eat and take in the sites.  They especially enjoyed walking the HB pier.  Complimentary breakfast was an added treat.  Best Western Huntington Beach Inn is a great location with great rooms at a reasonable price.  Highly recommend.

My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in October. We did not make reservations in advance and the front desk was very accommodating in finding us a room with as much view of the water as possible.   The rooms were nice and they were clean. Breakfast is OK, and is standard continental breakfast items. The room it is served in is very small and it can be a hassle to get your food if there are a lot of people there.   The best part of the hotel if you have some free time is the jacuzzi on the roof. You just have to ask the front desk for the key and leave an ID with them until you come back. There is a great view from up there!  The location of the hotel is great. It's right across from the beach and is a short walk from the busy area with restaurants and bars.

I've been in the hospitality business for many years so I take really bad reviews with a grain of salt. It doesn't take much to make the wrong person mad and they go on TripAdvisor and do a bad review just because they weren't "compensated" for their complaints.  My personal experience at this property is that it's just fine.  Nothing special, but nothing bad either.  I can't comment on the customer service because we didn't have any issues that needed to be addressed.which is a good thing!  Close to the beach, underground parking, walking distance to Main Street with great shopping and restaurants.  The fitness and breakfast rooms are clean and well-maintained.  Standard and plentiful breakfast options.  Front desk staff is friendly and the rooms & common areas are clean and

Summary Heading: Will NEVER go back-Worst customer service!!
Summary: Arrived for the promised balcony room, only to get NO balcony.  Our consolation was a fire place, only to have it NOT work.  When I called front desk, they had NO maintenance to help!  So, strike 2!  The beds & pillows are VERY uncomfortable, and the plumbing from above was going all night!  When I expressed my displeasure, the management could care less.  To top it all off, I left something in the room  & when I came back to get it a few hours later, of course the maids NEVER turned it in.  Horrible experience!!!!!  Do yourself a favor, and DON'T stay here.

We checked out after one night due to discovering a homeless person sleeping in the stairwell smoking a cigarette. He had access to any floor of the hotel!!!  Upon telling the front desk, the casual response was that "they get in through the parking garage.  Appaling that they know of security issues and do nothing!

Summary Heading: We loved it and can not wait to go back
Summary: Ray, who works the front desk is a wealth of information.  He is friendly and offers information.  You don't have to try  and hope to get quality information - he offers it. Good complimentary breakfest. He knows and lives in the area.

Make a reservation way in advance for a room with a king bed.  You arrive and get #105 which has to be the worst room in the building.  Only the hearing-challenged should get that room.  The ice machine, the PCH traffic noise funnelled along the wall separating you from the oil well next door, the plumbing noise from 107 next door when the guest decides to take a shower at 3:55 a.m..... Screech!, and the elevator mechanics on top of that!  So, we complain in the morning.  We're staying for a week.  We cannot put up with this.  We need a better location in the building.  Ahh, there is #111.  We check.  It looks good, and quiet.  We start to pack up to move.  The phone rings.  OOPS, sorry, can't have that room... renovations have been scheduled for the weekend.  So how about a

Summary Heading: Very RUDE!!!!! Ruined my friends birthday!
Summary: If you want a good time at the beach, DO NOT stay here! 1st off my GF pulls into the Hotel parking and parks in a parking spot. The manger runs out and tells her she can't park here. She tells him she's staying at the hotel. He yells at her and said were only allowed 1   parking spot and our friends have it  plus this is a 30min guest visitor  parking. She tells Him she's sorry   she didn't know that and she will  move. Another person then parks in.  the same spot and he doesn't  say anything to them. We thought well maybe their "guest visitor". We then spent about 10mins driving around looking for a spot to park. When we make our long walk back to the Hotel from hell. The manger see's there's 4 of us and tells us he wants to see our ID's and we have  to pay an extra $20. We

Summary Heading: Clean comfortable rooms, close to beach and shopping
Summary: This is our second stay here and we were pleased with room and service. Only complaint is that the jacuzzi was not working because it was being resurfaced.

Summary Heading: Absolutley the worst management in any Best Western Hotel !
Summary: The manager there was the rudest man we've ever encountered.  We cancelled a room with several weeks notice, and a cancellation number, AND a call from Best Western Headquarters....but the manager still stole money from us by charging our card .  Officials contacted him to refund us and he refused and said "I don't have to and I don't work like that".   We always stay at Best Westerns,and we love Huntington Beach and visit it often,  but  we will NEVER recommend that hotel to anyone. Shame on you.

Well not sure of some of the reviews, not sure they had the right hotel ! Not the biggest rooms , but  really clean tidy and with a small balcony. The cleaning staff seemed to be there 24/7. I am sure it can get a little noisy during peak time. ( bit like newquay, for all you english folk ) Free parking underground. Pretty decent breakfast, all basic but not bad. Waffle machine is new. Front desk staff not over friendly will agree, but the clean hotel in a wicked location sure make up for that. I am sure if you stay here you will not be in the hotel very long as you are 5 mins walk from the beautiful Huntington beach & all its wonderful places to eat and drink. If you want a full kind of spa hotel , not for you. But if you are here to sample the sea & city you should check it

I hated every second in this hotel.  It felt like you are checking in to a government run boarding school.  Staff are extremely rude.  Staff discriminate against guests in every way they could possibly do.  We felt humiliated and hurt.    The place is run down and dirty.  The rooms are smelly and just horrible. Building work across the road.  The dumpster is right by the balcony. Washing hanging over balconies. We could not wait to get the hell out that place.  And dont be fooled - you pay when you check in and they are independant hotels in the the Best Western group.

Summary Heading: Worst Customer Service I have ever experienced
Summary: This hotel was the worst experience of any Best Westerns I have stayed at. The staff is rude,  insulting, and if you are young will use age discrimination against you. When we checked in our bathroom door was broken so had to switch rooms and the front desk complained that they would have to reclean the bathroom... If it is that hard for them to clean it, I wonder how well they clean the rest of the rooms. The room keys only work somtimes, we had many trips to front desk to get them rekeyed. There is a breath taking view of an oil pump and an abandon restaurant with boarded up windows from one side of the hotel that is distracting from the "ocean view rooms" that you pay more for. This hotel is kinda ressembles a resort hotel...each room has a balcony and it's about 3 stories high. Summary Heading: Average hotel in a great location
Summary: This is an average hotel in a great location. It is directly on the Pacific Coast Highway and very close to the main hub of Huntington Beach. As such, expect a high level of road noise. The hotel is a bit run down, but, with the price comparison to the other hotels in the immediate area, it is adequate for the price. The contintental breakfast is cramped and limited, but is good enough to get a free meal in the morning. The underground parking is very convenient, just be careful going in/out. Also, the sushi bar up the block is highly recommended!!

Summary Heading: Great stay yet again! I highly recommend!!
Summary: This is my second time staying here and I wanted to boost their review. I got a great rate on Bestwestern.com and had a great room. Yes it is next to Taco Bell, yes there are oil diggers next door... BUT,.... it is across the street from the ocean. Just three blocks to the pier and Main Street. It's great if you want to go out at night and not worry about driving home. It was awesome to go to a less crowded part of the beach and not have to pay to park. Our room was clean and the front desk was very nice.  We were even able to check out a little later than normal. Overall I would say this was a great stay for the money. The higher priced hotels are far from the Main Street/Pier area and not in the action. This is a great place with kids or single adults.

The location for this hotel is ideal if you want to be near the beach and town. It is walking distance to main street and the beach is right across the highway. The woman at the front desk was very rude and the noise from highway 1 is loud so try to request a room towards the back. Overall an okay hotel for a short trip, but I wouldn't stay here for a special occasion. The rooms are large yet dark and the breakfast is awful! I will check out the other independent hotels on PCH before I stay here again.

My boyfriend and I stayed there 3 nights before heading to Vegas. We had the managers special, and were given rooms on the 2nd floor with an ocean view..however there was some sort of oil pump in the view. It seems there are quite a few in the city. Huntington Beach is a beautiful town. We didn't have the best weather. Our room was clean, front desk could have been nicer. We didn't eat the breakfast there, but walked to Main St. which was only like a 3 block walk to eat. Overall the hotel was OK, but you get what you pay for. If you are looking for luxury then check into the Hyatt or Hilton up the block, but expect to pay more $$$$.
